goals.question: What is the distribution of departure delays?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of departure delays and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between arrival and departure delays?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of arrival delays vs departure delays
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between arrival and departure delays.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight distances?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of flight distances and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of cancelled flights?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of cancelled flights by airline
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which airlines have the highest number of cancelled flights.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays by airline?
goals.visualization: Box plot of flight delays by airline
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of flight delays by airline and identify any outliers.

code:
```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('flights-airport.csv')

# Plot histogram of departure delays
sns.histplot(data=data, x='DepDelay', kde=True, color='blue')
plt.axvline(x=data['DepDelay'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['DepDelay'].median()))
plt.title('What is the distribution of departure delays?')
plt.legend()
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('flights-airport.csv')

# Plot scatter plot of arrival delays vs departure delays
sns.scatterplot(x='DEPARTURE_DELAY', y='ARRIVAL_DELAY', data=data)

# Set chart title
plt.title('What is the relationship between arrival and departure delays?', wrap=True)

# Return plot object
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('flights-airport.csv')

# Plot histogram of flight distances
sns.histplot(data=data, x='distance', kde=True, color='blue')
plt.axvline(data['distance'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean distance: {:.2f}'.format(data['distance'].mean()))
plt.legend()
plt.title('What is the distribution of flight distances?')
plt.xlabel('Distance (miles)')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('flights-airport.csv')

# Plot
sns.set_style("whitegrid")
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
sns.countplot(x='AIRLINE', hue='CANCELLED', data=data)
plt.title('What is the distribution of cancelled flights?')
plt.legend(title='Cancelled', loc='upper right', labels=['Not Cancelled', 'Cancelled'])
plt.xlabel('Airline')
plt.ylabel('Count')

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

data = pd.read_csv('flights-airport.csv')

sns.set(style="whitegrid")
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(15, 10))

sns.boxplot(x="AIRLINE", y="DEPARTURE_DELAY", data=data, ax=ax, palette="Set3")

plt.title("What is the distribution of flight delays by airline?", wrap=True)
plt.xlabel("Airline")
plt.ylabel("Departure Delay (minutes)")

plt.show()
```
